xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: A module for performing various operations on files and directories stored in the server file system.
List all files and directories under the specified directory. This method is only available to the DBA role.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $path The directory path or URI in the file system.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: node()* : a node describing file and directory names and meta data.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:directory-list
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: file:directory-list($path as item(), $pattern as xs:string) as node()?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
List all files, including their file size and modification time, found in or below a directory, $directory. Files are located in the server's file system, using filename patterns, $pattern. File pattern matching is based on code from Apache's Ant, thus following the same conventions. For example:
'*.xml' matches any file ending with .xml in the current directory, - '**/*.xml' matches files in any directory below the specified directory. This method is only available to the DBA role.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $path The base directory path or URI in the file system where the files are located.
$pattern The file name pattern
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: node()? : a node fragment that shows all matching filenames, including their file size and modification time, and the subdirectory they were found in

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:string? : the file contents

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:serialize
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: file:serialize($node-set as node()*, $path as item(), $parameters as item()*) as xs:boolean?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Writes the node set into a file on the file system. $parameters contains a sequence of zero or more serialization parameters specified as key=value pairs. The serialization options are the same as those recognized by "declare option exist:serialize". The function does NOT automatically inherit the serialization options of the XQuery it is called from. This method is only available to the DBA role.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $node-set* The contents to write to the file system.
$path The full path or URI to the file
$parameters* The serialization parameters: either a sequence of key=value pairs or an output:serialization-parameters element as defined by the standard fn:serialize function.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:boolean? : true on success - false if the specified file can not be created or is not writable. The empty sequence is returned if the argument sequence is empty.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:serialize
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: file:serialize($node-set as node()*, $path as item(), $parameters as item()*, $append as xs:boolean) as xs:boolean?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Writes the node set into a file on the file system, optionally appending to it. $parameters contains a sequence of zero or more serialization parameters specified as key=value pairs. The serialization options are the same as those recognized by "declare option exist:serialize". The function does NOT automatically inherit the serialization options of the XQuery it is called from. This method is only available to the DBA role.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $node-set* The contents to write to the file system.
$path The full path or URI to the file
$parameters* The serialization parameters: either a sequence of key=value pairs or an output:serialization-parameters element as defined by the standard fn:serialize function.
$append Should content be appended?
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:boolean? : true on success - false if the specified file can not be created or is not writable. The empty sequence is returned if the argument sequence is empty.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: file:sync
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: file:sync($collection as xs:string, $targetPath as item(), $dateTime as xs:dateTime?) as xs:boolean

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Synchronize a collection with a directory hierarchy. Compares last modified time stamps. If $dateTime is given, only resources modified after this time stamp are taken into account. This method is only available to the DBA role.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $collection The collection to sync.
$targetPath The full path or URI to the directory
$dateTime? Optional: only resources modified after the given date/time will be synchronized.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:boolean : true if successful, false otherwise
